title: Classic Food Commercials
description: Test your memory of the unforgettable food commercials and jingles that became part of American pop culture!

questions.question: Which cereal commercial featured a rabbit who was always told 'Silly rabbit, Trix are for kids!'?
questions.explanation: The Trix Rabbit has been trying to get a bowl of Trix cereal since 1959. Kids always caught him in disguise and declared 'Silly rabbit, Trix are for kids!'

questions.question: What candy commercial asked 'How many licks does it take to get to the Tootsie Roll center of a Tootsie Pop?'
questions.explanation: The 1969 Tootsie Pop commercial featured Mr. Owl counting 'One... two-hoo... three' licks before biting the pop. The world may never know the true answer.

questions.question: Which fast food chain's commercial featured an elderly woman peering into a hamburger bun and asking 'Where's the beef?'
questions.explanation: Clara Peller starred in the 1984 Wendy's commercial, examining competitors' small hamburger patties and demanding 'Where's the beef?' It became a national catchphrase.

questions.question: Which commercial featured a young boy offering his Coca-Cola to football player 'Mean' Joe Greene in a stadium tunnel?
questions.explanation: The 1979 'Hey Kid, Catch!' Coca-Cola commercial showed a boy offering his Coke to an injured Mean Joe Greene, who then tossed the kid his jersey. It's considered one of the greatest commercials ever made.

questions.question: What cereal's commercial featured the test 'He likes it! Hey Mikey!' with a finicky young boy?
questions.explanation: The 1972 Life Cereal commercial showed two brothers getting their picky little brother Mikey to try the cereal. 'He likes it! Hey Mikey!' became one of the most quoted commercial lines.

questions.question: Which beer brand's commercial featured Clydesdales pulling a wagon through snowy landscapes?
questions.explanation: Budweiser's Clydesdale horses have appeared in their commercials since 1933. The majestic horses pulling the beer wagon through snow became an iconic holiday advertising tradition.

questions.question: Which commercial jingle sang 'I'd like to buy the world a Coke' on a hillside with people from many countries?
questions.explanation: The 1971 'Hilltop' Coca-Cola commercial featuring young people singing 'I'd Like to Buy the World a Coke' on an Italian hillside is considered one of the greatest commercials ever made.

questions.question: What Oscar Mayer commercial taught children to spell the brand name through a catchy jingle?
options: The Oscar Mayer Hot Dog Song
My Bologna Has a First Name
questions.explanation: 'My Bologna Has a First Name' debuted in 1973, with a child singing the letters of O-S-C-A-R and M-A-Y-E-R. The jingle was so catchy that generations of Americans can still sing it.

questions.question: Which potato chip commercial used the slogan 'Once you pop, you can't stop'?
questions.explanation: Pringles used the catchy slogan 'Once you pop, you can't stop' (originally 'Once you pop, the fun don't stop') starting in the 1980s, referring to the pop of opening their cylindrical can.

questions.question: What commercial showed a boy bringing his friends back after his mother gave him a glass of Hawaiian Punch?
options: How about a nice Hawaiian Punch?
questions.explanation: Hawaiian Punch commercials featured the mascot Punchy asking 'How about a nice Hawaiian Punch?' then punching the other character. The phrase became a playground joke for decades.

questions.question: Which fast food chain used the jingle 'You deserve a break today'?
questions.explanation: McDonald's 'You Deserve a Break Today' jingle launched in 1971 and was named the number one jingle of the 20th century by Advertising Age magazine.

questions.question: What commercial featured a man accidentally dropping his chocolate into someone's peanut butter, creating an iconic candy combination?
questions.explanation: Reese's Peanut Butter Cups commercials in the 1970s and 1980s featured two people colliding, one eating chocolate, the other eating peanut butter: 'You got your chocolate in my peanut butter!'

questions.question: Which cereal's commercial featured a cuckoo bird going 'Cuckoo for Cocoa Puffs!'?
questions.explanation: Sonny the Cuckoo Bird has been going crazy for Cocoa Puffs since 1962. His catchphrase 'I'm cuckoo for Cocoa Puffs!' and his wild antics made him one of the most memorable cereal mascots.

questions.question: What Alka-Seltzer commercial featured a man who ate too much and groaned 'I can't believe I ate the whole thing'?
options: The 'I Can't Believe I Ate the Whole Thing' commercial
questions.explanation: The 1972 Alka-Seltzer commercial showed a man in bed moaning 'I can't believe I ate the whole thing' to his wife. It perfectly captured the consequences of overindulgence.

questions.question: Which brand's commercial featured a Native American man with a tear rolling down his cheek while looking at litter and pollution?
questions.explanation: The 1971 Keep America Beautiful PSA featured Iron Eyes Cody (as a Native American) shedding a single tear at the sight of pollution. While not a food commercial, it aired during food commercial breaks and became iconic.
